body:
Just fought with this leak myself, happy to see this in play.  The approach I took was to add the below to the teardown_fixtures method in fixtures.rb, which seems consistent with the original callbacks commit ( https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/b07073924002fd56ac5b63b24cb9318b3dee45c4 ) and should allow for the actual rollback callbacks to take effect in tests (for, e.g., cleanup of external references if any, etc.).  Any thoughts on this spin instead/as well?


  def teardown_fixtures
...
    # Rollback changes if a transaction is active.                                                                                                                                
    if run_in_transaction? && ActiveRecord::Base.connection.open_transactions != 0
      ActiveRecord::Base.connection.rollback_db_transaction
+      ActiveRecord::Base.connection.send(:rollback_transaction_records,true) if ActiveRecord::Base.connection.instance_variable_get('@_current_transaction_records')
      ActiveRecord::Base.connection.decrement_open_transactions
    end
    ActiveRecord::Base.clear_active_connections!
  end
